tasks.task: Drive an agricultural tractor through a field.
subtasks: Sit in the driver's seat and operate the steering wheel.
Adjust the speed of the tractor using the throttle lever.
Monitor the route to avoid obstacles.
Navigate around uneven terrain if necessary.

tasks.task: Operate an agricultural sprayer attached to the tractor.
subtasks: Connect the sprayer to the tractor's hydraulic system.
Operate the spray nozzle to apply agriculture chemicals.
Check the fluid levels and replace when necessary.

tasks.task: Harvest crops using a harvester attached to the tractor.
subtasks: Load the harvester onto the tractor if needed.
Attach the crop harvester to the tractor.
Drive the tractor through the harvested field.
Operate the harvester to cut and collect the crops.
Walk along the field to collect soil samples.
Use a soil probe or sampler to collect samples from various locations.
Label and store the soil samples for testing.

tasks.task: Repair minor equipment issues on the tractor.
subtasks: Locate the problem area on the tractor.
Identify the components causing the issue.
Fix or replace broken or worn-out parts.
Load the lime onto the spreader.
Attach the lime spreader to the tractor.
Drive the tractor through the field.
Operate the spreader to distribute the lime evenly.
Position the tractor for plowing.
Engage the plow attachment.
Drive the tractor in straight lines to cover the field.
Adjust the depth and angle of the plow as needed.
Deliver mulch to the field.
Spread the mulch using a spreader.
Monitor the distribution to ensure even coverage.
Repeat the process for multiple areas of the field.
Position the mower attachment on the tractor.
Adjust the cutting height.
Drive the tractor through the area needing mowed.
Collect or handle the cut material.

tasks.task: Conduct a scouting check for pests or diseases.
subtasks: Walk through the field to spot potential issues.
Take notes or photographs of problem areas.
Report findings to agricultural advisor.
Select the appropriate pruning tools.
Identify branches or sections to remove.
Prune with sharp tools, being careful not to damage the plant.
Clean up and properly dispose of debris.
Inspect the irrigation lines for leaks or damages.
Test the sprinklers or drip lines for functionality.
Adjust sprinkler heads or emitters as needed.
Monitor water pressure and application rates.

tasks.task: Graze livestock; round up and move cattle using a tractor.
subtasks: Use the tractor to herd cattle into a designated area.
Ensure all cattle are accounted for.
Guide the cattle to the next grazing location or to the handling facility.
Prepare the spreader or fertilizer applicator.
Check the calibration of the applicator.
Attach the fertilizer applicator to the tractor.
Apply the fertilizer evenly across the field.

tasks.task: Cultivate soil to prepare for planting.
subtasks: Choose the appropriate cultivation tool for the soil type.
Secure the tool to the tractor.
Operate the cultivator to loosen and aerate the soil.
Set the depth of the tillage.

tasks.task: Attend to animals in a barn or stable.
subtasks: Feed the livestock.
Clean the stalls or pen areas.
Check the health and wellbeing of the animals.
Assemble the necessary tools and materials.
Measure and cut wood or other building materials.
Construct or reconstruct the structure.
Secure the structure with proper fastenings.

tasks.task: Conduct a pest management task; possibly trapping or applying insecticides.
subtasks: Identify the pest species causing damage.
Set or place traps in the affected areas.
Apply insecticides or other pesticides as directed.
Collect soil samples from the field.
Mail the samples to a lab for analysis.
Review the results and determine necessary amendments.

tasks.task: Check the cattle for external parasites.
subtasks: Examine the cattle for mites, ticks, lice, or other ectoparasites.
Use appropriate treatment products to remove parasites.

tasks.task: Plant seeds using a grain drill.
subtasks: Secure the grain drill to the tractor.
Set the drill to the correct planting depth and spacing.
Operate the drill as the tractor moves across the field.
Ensure even distribution of seed and proper cover.

tasks.task: Manage a silage management task, such as cutting and collecting silage.
Use a boundary sprayer to treat field edges or ditches.
Enter and exit a field with an equipment attachment.

subtasks: Sit in the driver's seat and operate the steering wheel.
